result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javon N Crowley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Javon N Crowley not in court.  Attorney Christian Thomas appeared by video for Javon N Crowley.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. 
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 30.
Calendar call scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Order Appointing Counsel, signed and filed.

Defendant Javon N Crowley appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christian Thomas appeared as a friend of the Court by video for defendant Javon N Crowley.
Case in court for status conference.
Attorney Christian Thomas informed the Court that he represents the defendant on another matter.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  
Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  
The court appointed Attorney Christian Thomas to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. 
The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $75.00 per month beginning the first month the case is completed and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. 

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. 

Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Javon N Crowley appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defendant may qualify for public defender representation. Discussion held.
Case adjourned for status of counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/20/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Javon N Crowley in court with Attorney Christian Thomas as a friend of the court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge 30, Branch Richards.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/18/2022@2p
